title: First Steps
description: Your journey begins here. Simple moves, proper form. Just show up â€” that's the hardest part.

exercises.name: Pushups (Knees OK)
cues: Lower until chest nearly touches floor

exercises.name: Plank Hold
cues: Straight line from head to heels
Squeeze your core like bracing for a punch
Breathe steadily â€” don't hold your breath

exercises.name: Lunges
cues: Push back to start through front heel

exercises.name: Jumping Jacks
cues: Land softly on the balls of your feet

title: Build On It
description: Day 2 â€” you came back. That already puts you ahead of most people. Let's build on yesterday.

exercises.name: Bodyweight Squats
cues: Sit back like into a chair

exercises.name: Lunges (Each Leg)
cues: 90Â° bend in both knees at the bottom

title: Finding Rhythm
description: Three days in â€” you're finding your groove. Today we add mountain climbers to the mix.

exercises.name: Bodyweight Squats
cues: Control the descent â€” don't drop

exercises.name: Pushups
cues: Slow on the way down, push up strong

exercises.name: Plank Hold
cues: Imagine pulling belly button to spine

exercises.name: Reverse Lunges
cues: Easier on knees than forward lunges

exercises.name: Mountain Climbers
cues: Hands under shoulders in plank position

title: Push Day
description: Today's all about your upper body. Multiple pushup variations â€” your chest and arms will thank you tomorrow.

exercises.name: Wide Pushups
cues: Targets chest more than standard pushups

exercises.name: Diamond Pushups (Knees OK)
cues: Hands form a diamond under chest
Targets triceps â€” go to knees if needed

exercises.name: Plank Hold
cues: Push the ground away from you

exercises.name: Shoulder Taps
cues: Tap opposite shoulder, minimize hip rotation

exercises.name: Pushups
cues: Final push â€” give it everything
Maintain good form even when tired
Partial reps count if you hit the wall

title: Legs Day
description: Strong legs carry everything. Squats, lunges, and your first wall sit. Embrace the burn.

exercises.name: Bodyweight Squats
cues: Full depth â€” hips below knees if possible

exercises.name: Calf Raises
cues: Rise up on your toes as high as possible
Pause at the top for 1 second
Lower slowly â€” control the negative

exercises.name: Wall Sit
cues: Don't push off your knees with hands

title: Core Focus
description: Your core is the foundation of every movement. Six exercises, zero excuses. Let's build that stability.

exercises.name: Plank Hold
cues: Forearms on ground, elbows under shoulders

exercises.name: Crunches
cues: Lift shoulders off the ground, not your lower back
Hands behind head â€” don't pull your neck

exercises.name: Bicycle Crunches
cues: Slow and controlled beats fast and sloppy

exercises.name: Side Plank (Left)
cues: Stack feet or stagger for balance
Hips up â€” don't let them sag

exercises.name: Side Plank (Right)
cues: Engage obliques â€” feel them work

exercises.name: Leg Raises
cues: Lie flat, hands under lower back for support
Raise legs to 90Â° then lower slowly
Press lower back into the floor

title: Full Body
description: One week in! Today we hit everything â€” burpees, squats, pushups, plank, climbers. You're ready.

exercises.name: Burpees (No Pushup)
cues: Squat down, hands to floor, jump feet back
Jump feet forward, then jump up
Modify: step back instead of jumping

exercises.name: Bodyweight Squats
cues: You know these by now â€” own them

exercises.name: Pushups
cues: Chest to floor, arms to full extension

exercises.name: Plank Hold
cues: You've done this before â€” push for the full 30
Almost there when it starts to shake

exercises.name: Mountain Climbers
cues: Drive those knees â€” finish strong

title: Endurance
description: Higher reps, longer holds. This one's about stamina. Push through the discomfort â€” that's where growth lives.

exercises.name: Bodyweight Squats
cues: Last five should burn â€” that's the point

exercises.name: Plank Hold
cues: 40 seconds â€” new personal best territory
When it shakes, you're getting stronger
Focus on breathing to distract from the burn

exercises.name: Lunges
cues: Stay upright â€” don't lean forward

exercises.name: Burpees (No Pushup)
cues: The finisher â€” leave it all here
Step back if jumping is too much

title: Strength
description: Explosive moves and tough variations. You've built the base â€” now show what you can do.

exercises.name: Jump Squats
cues: Land like a ninja â€” soft and quiet

exercises.name: Diamond Pushups
cues: Elbows flare naturally â€” that's fine
Go to knees for last few if needed

exercises.name: Wide Pushups
cues: Push the floor apart to rise

exercises.name: Plank Hold
cues: Break it into 3 chunks of 15 mentally
You're almost at the end of the program

exercises.name: Burpees (No Pushup)
cues: Full send â€” you've earned this strength

title: The Test
description: Everything you've built, put to the test. Higher reps, longer holds, zero quit. You've got this. ğŸ†

exercises.name: Jump Squats
cues: This is what strong feels like

exercises.name: Pushups
cues: 15 clean reps â€” you couldn't do 5 on day 1
Break into sets if you must, but finish all 15

exercises.name: Plank Hold
cues: One full minute â€” the ultimate test
Your mind will quit before your body

exercises.name: Burpees (No Pushup)
cues: Keep moving â€” rest standing, not on the floor

exercises.name: Mountain Climbers
cues: The grand finale â€” empty the tank
Fast, furious, and all the way
You just completed Foundations. Legend. ğŸ†
